comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

I changed my settings no "No Proxy" connection


Actual results:

The websites should have worked properly, because before and after I change this setting, I still cannot access anything after 5 or 10 minutes of using the browser


Expected results:

The websites should have started loading and they're not.
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928134238

Steps to reproduce:

I changed my settings no "No Proxy" connection


Actual results:

The websites should have worked properly, because before and after I change this setting, I still cannot access anything after 5 or 10 minutes of using the browser


Expected results:

The websites should have started loading and they're not.

We need more information.
"it doesn't work" or "cannot access" is a bad description for a problem.
Do you get an error message and which one ?
Does it help if you check (alt key)/tools/work offline twice to set Firefox in the offline mode and back online ?
A restart of Firefox fixes the issue ?
Do you use a third party firewall software ?

comments.text:
Bug 692260?
Try to reset network.http.max-connections in about:config to 32.
comments.raw_text:
Bug 692260?
Try to reset network.http.max-connections in about:config to 32.
